snippet: “John Carter,” Disney’s big-budget epic, is a new example of the Hollywood studios’ habit of pouring more money into looming flops to stay on good terms with their stars.
abstract: John Carter, Disney’s big-budget film epic directed by Andrew Stanton, is the latest example of the Hollywood studios’ habit of pouring more money into looming flops to stay on good terms with their stars, in this case Stanton; film cost an estimated $350 million to make and market, taking in only about $30.6 million at the North American box office, forcing Disney to take a quarterly write-down.
lead_paragraph: “John Carter,” Disney’s big-budget epic, is a new example of the Hollywood studios’ habit of pouring more money into looming flops to stay on good terms with their stars.
